Question: This person's remains were carried by "servants, family and friends" to the family grave site at Monticello.
Hints: Shortly before leaving office, in March 1809, this person signed the repeal of the disastrous Embargo.
The bill was not passed; this person favored an amendment.
On February 17, 1801, after thirty-six ballots, the House elected this person President and Burr Vice President.
